moTa: The Chrysler 200 is available as a sedan and convertible. The 2017 200 starts at $22,115 (MSRP), with a destination charge of $1,095. It gets EPA-estimated 23-29 MPG combined. The Chrysler 200 competes against models like the Acura ILX, Audi A3, and Honda Accord Hybrid. The 200 is a good fit for sun lovers Sun Lover vehicles have convertible tops or removable roofs. May require specific trim level and/or optional features. and small families Small Family vehicles include mid-size and larger sedans, hatchbacks, wagons, SUVs and minivans with four doors and five seats. .

The Chrysler 300 is available as a sedan. The 2018 300 starts at $28,995 (MSRP), with a destination charge of $1,345. It gets EPA-estimated 19-23 MPG combined. The Chrysler 300 competes against models like the Mercedes-Benz CLA 250, Honda Civic, and Ford Fusion Energi. The 300 is a good fit for small families Small Family vehicles include mid-size and larger sedans, hatchbacks, wagons, SUVs and minivans with four doors and five seats. .

The Chrysler 300C is available as a coming soon and sedan. The Chrysler 300C competes against models like the Dodge Charger, Chevrolet SS, and Hyundai Sonata Plug-In Hybrid. The 300C is a good fit for small families Small Family vehicles include mid-size and larger sedans, hatchbacks, wagons, SUVs and minivans with four doors and five seats. .

The Chrysler Pacifica is available as a minivan, passenger van and SUV. The 2018 Pacifica starts at $26,995 (MSRP), with a destination charge of $1,345. It gets EPA-estimated 22 MPG combined. The Chrysler Pacifica competes against models like the Kia Sedona, Dodge Grand Caravan, and Toyota Sienna. The Pacifica is a good fit for towing Towing vehicles can tow a minimum of 2,000 pounds (see specifications for maximum). May require specific trim level and/or optional features. and large families Large Family vehicles seat six or more occupants in three rows. .

The Chrysler Pacifica Hybrid is available as a passenger van. The 2018 Pacifica Hybrid starts at $39,995 (MSRP), with a destination charge of $1,345. The Chrysler Pacifica Hybrid competes against models like the GMC Savana 3500, Chevrolet Express 3500, and Mercedes-Benz Sprinter 2500. The Pacifica Hybrid is a good fit for large families Large Family vehicles seat six or more occupants in three rows. .

The Chrysler Town & Country is available as a minivan. Inventory prices for the 2016 Town & Country range from $12,987 to $32,267. It gets EPA-estimated 21 MPG combined. The Chrysler Town & Country competes against models like the Honda Odyssey, Kia Sedona, and Nissan Quest. The Town & Country is a good fit for towing Towing vehicles can tow a minimum of 2,000 pounds (see specifications for maximum). May require specific trim level and/or optional features. and large families Large Family vehicles seat six or more occupants in three rows. .
